name: Cooking from the Glossies: Fig, Goat Cheese, and Caramelized Onion Sandwiches
description: Photograph by Lucy Baker. To my delight, fig season seems to be extra long-lasting this year. Normally, the delicate, tear drop-shaped fruits are only available for a few short weeks at the end of summer. But here we are in...
recipeIngredient: 3 medium onions, halved and thinly sliced
1/3 cup fresh goat cheese (3 1/2 ounces), room temperature
1/2 pound ripe fresh figs (about 8) stemmed and thinly sliced

recipeInstructions.text: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium. Add onions, and season with salt and pepper. Cover, and cook, stirring occasionally, until onions have softened, 8 to 10 minutes. Uncover; cook until onions are golden brown, 10 to 12 minutes more (if skillet begins to darken, add 1/4 cup water).
Dividing evenly, spread cheese on 4 bread slices. Top with onions and figs; sandwich with remaining bread.
